data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3623855,"name":"","username":"ElectricTurtle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/electricturtle/{size}/260014_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-14T02:32:06.025Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello! I have programmed an auto align command for our robot, but my lead programmer would like that I test it in the WPILIB simulator beforehand. My question is, has anybody written a limelight helper class that simulates at least the getBotPose_TargetSpace() function in the WPILIB simulator, thanks!\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-05-14T02:32:06.025Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":186,"readers_count":185,"score":77.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":501690,"topic_slug":"limelight-simulation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":73261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/limelight-simulation/501690/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3624003,"name":"Curt Rozeboom","username":"BlueEpiphone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blueepiphone/{size}/197122_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-14T12:57:07.694Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eTo do this, we’ve simply wrapped our vision classes in an interface class and then used PhotonVision’s simulator as the simulation implementation. So, instead of simulating that \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eLL\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Limelight, an integrated vision coprocessor\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e function, you’d simulate a getPose function as part of the interface. Here’s our \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FRC5010/Reefscape2025/blob/main/TigerShark2025/src/main/java/org/frc5010/common/sensors/camera/GenericCamera.java\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003eGenericCamera\u003c/a\u003e class, as an example, along with the \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/FRC5010/Reefscape2025/blob/main/TigerShark2025/src/main/java/org/frc5010/common/sensors/camera/SimulatedCamera.java\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003esimulated camera\u003c/a\u003e implementation. It does mean that you need to learn how to do PhotonVision along with \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eLL\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Limelight, an integrated vision coprocessor\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, but they aren’t too dissimilar. You can probably figure out how to do this in a way that works best with your own code.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-05-14T12:57:07.694Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":65.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":501690,"topic_slug":"limelight-simulation","display_username":"Curt
